mixed-citation.article-title: Systematic revision of the pantropical whip spider family Charinidae Quintero, 1986 (Arachnida, Amblypygi)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Sarax sangkulirangensis
Rahmadi et al. , 2010: 11–13
, figs 21–25, 37–38.

Based on the original description (
Rahmadi et al . 2010
), this species may be separated from other species of
Sarax
in Southeast Asia and Oceania by the following combination of characters: relatively small size (adult body length 5.9–9.8 mm ); sexual dimorphism absent; pedipalp tarsus with two spines, proximal spine about half as long as distal spine; leg IV tibia with 19 trichobothria, bt situated medially on fourth basitibial article, and bc situated closer to bf than to sbf .

Paratypes INDONESIA • 1 ♂ ; Gua Danum Tengen , near Tebo Lake , Merapun Village , Kelai District , Berau Regency ; 01°31′28.5″ N , 117°22′4.9″ E ;
2 Sep. 2004
; Y.R. Suhardjono leg.; MZB Ambl. 150 [not examined]
•
1 juv. ; Tabalar Ulu , Gua Louwading , Tabalar Ulu District , Berau Regency ,
11 Aug. 2004
, L. Deharveng and A. Bedos leg.; KAL-059; MNHN Am. 10 [not examined]
•
1 ♂ ; Gua Ampanas ; 01°12′01.46″ N , 117°44′03.58″ E ; Pengadan Village , Sangkulirang District , Kutai Timur Regency ;
8 Aug. 2004
; L. Deharveng and A. Bedos leg.; KAL-113
•
1 ♂ ; same collection data as for preceding; MNHN Am. 11 [not examined]
.
Known from only the type localities in Indonesia .

See
Rahmadi et al. (2010)
for a description.
